name: Country Music and the Movies Quiz | Country Music | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which movie contained the songs "Could I Have This Dance" by Anne Murray, "Stand by Me" by Mickey Gilley, and "Lookin' for Love" by Johnny Lee?
questions.explanation:
Urban Cowboy.

	"Urban Cowboy" starred John Travolta and Debra Winger and centered around the Honky Tonk Gilley's in Pasadena, Texas.  Other songs included "Hello Texas" by Jimmy Buffet and "All Night Long" by Joe Walsh.

questions.text: Which movie included the Willie Nelson song "On The Road Again"?
options: The Last Days Of Frank And Jesse James
questions.explanation:
Honeysuckle Rose.

	"Honeysuckle Rose" starred Willie Nelson, Dyan Cannon, and Amy Irving.

questions.text: Which of the following songs was not from the movie "Pure Country" starring George Strait?
options: When Did You Stop Loving Me
questions.explanation:
One Night at a Time.

	"Pure Country" also starred Leslie Ann Warren and Isabel Glasser.  Other songs included "I Cross My Heart" and "Overnight Male".  On "Heartland (Main Title Version)", George Strait shares the vocals with his son, George (Bubba) Jr.

questions.text: Who sang the song "How Do I Live" on the soundtrack to "Con Air"?
questions.explanation:
Trisha Yearwood.

	Orginally, LeAnn had recorded it for the movie, but the producers of the movie thought the song was too mature for her, so they replaced her with Trisha Yearwood.  Both released the song and both had big hits with it, Trisha on the Country Chart and LeAnn on the Pop Chart.

questions.text: From which movie was the Faith Hill song "There You'll Be"?
questions.explanation:
Pearl Harbor.

	"Pearl Harbor" starred Ben Affleck, Josh Hartnett, and Kate Beckinsale.

questions.text: Which movie was Reba McEntire's first one?
questions.explanation:
Tremors.

	Reba co-starred with Kevin Bacon as the gun-toting wife of Michael Gross, who played Steven Keaton on "Family Ties".

questions.text: From which movie is the Garth Brooks' song "When You Come Back To Me"?
questions.explanation:
Frequency.

	The song can be heard over the closing credits of the James Caviezel/Dennis Quaid movie. It can also be found on Garth's album "Scarecrow".

questions.text: Which country music performer's character from "Maverick" was listed as Sweet-Faced Gambler?
questions.explanation:
Clint Black.

	All of the above had roles in the movie, along with Kathy Mattea and Carlene Carter.

questions.text: Which movie included the Martina McBride song "I Love You"?
questions.explanation:
Runaway Bride.

	"Runaway Bride" also included The Dixie Chicks' song "Ready To Run".

questions.text: The title of the George Strait song "Blue Clear Sky" was taken from a line from a movie.  Which movie?
questions.explanation:
Forrest Gump.

	Many artists passed over the song because they felt the words didn't make sense and should be "Clear Blue Sky". Then George Strait found out that the song was taken from "Forrest Gump" and he jumped all over it and took the song to #1.  The line can be heard in the movie toward the end.  There is a scene in which President Reagan is shown getting shot and then Forrest gets a letter from Jenny, where Forrest says the line.
